channel.title: (Delta) Making spawn points and adding more groups
channel.description:
1. How do I add custom spawn points with commands? {ex} ::home
2. How do I add more groups like Owner, Admin and Mod?
Many thanks, Hoolahguru

item.title: (Delta) Making spawn points and adding more groups
item.dc:creator: @Hookahguru Hookahguru
item.description:
@Hookahguru wrote:

Thanks for the help, but what im asking for the groups is how do I add a new class?

{ex}
1- mod
2- admin
3- owner
4- (new class name)

Read full topic
item.source: (Delta) Making spawn points and adding more groups

item.title: (Delta) Making spawn points and adding more groups
item.dc:creator: @Ddragonimp Ddragonimp
item.description:
@Ddragonimp wrote:

^^^^^

					playerName = null;
					disconnected = true;
					destruct();
				}

				// mod/admin level crown fix -bakatool
if (playerRights == 3)
					out.write(6);
				else if (playerRights == 2)
					out.write(2);
				else if (playerRights == 1)
					out.write(1);
				else if(donator == 1 && playerRights == 0)
					out.write(7);
				else if(donator == 1 && playerRights == 4)
					out.write(7);
				
				else
					out.write(playerRights);

				out.write( 0) ; // no log
				updateRequired = true;
				appearanceUpdateRequired = true;

located in the client.java

item.title: (Delta) Making spawn points and adding more groups
item.dc:creator: @II_Jacob_II II Jacob II
item.description:
@II_Jacob_II wrote:

^^^

Thats depending on what you’re planning to do with player rights, If you’re going to apply player rights to someone then yes, if you want to change the picture, thats the client, or the name, thats elsewhere in the source, I don’t know where exaclty for Delta tho’.

item.title: (Delta) Making spawn points and adding more groups
item.dc:creator: @Hookahguru Hookahguru
item.description:
@Hookahguru wrote:

[quote=“Epic Steve, post:2, topic:392379”]2. PlayerRights.

0 = Player.
1 = Mod.
2 = Admin
3 = Owner.[/quote]
Where is this found?

[quote=“jmk600, post:3, topic:392379”]1.

[code]if (command.startsWith(“home”) {
toX = XXXX;
toY = YYYY;

}[/code]

That’s just the simple one though[/quote]
And im guessing this is in client.java?

Thanks for the help,
Hookahguru
